topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557901166368726108000efd#post_557901166368726108000efd

"@Too_Offensive":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557901806368727f5f000303#post_557901806368727f5f000303

[spoiler]Except when he was such a selfish jerk you sided with Adewale when he decided to leave the Jackdaw. Yes, he redeemed himself but the point still stands that he went too far at times.[/spoiler]

Connor was pretty much kicked in the balls through his entire life and his demeanor always made me think of someone who was one step away from saying f*ck all and went on a killing rampage but he never did because it wasn't going to help anyone.

Remember, negative character traits aren't a bad thing when handled correctly.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/557902336368727f5f0003e0#post_557902336368727f5f0003e0
Connor was, in my opinion, mature for someone of his age. He was not the kind that would fool around and would always finish his job but he still has his morality to know what's right and wrong. That's hat made him different than others. He was the closest to Altair in terms of personality than any other protagonist.
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976

topics.body: HOLY SHIT DANNY THREW IN THE TOWEL AND GAVE UP ON GUILD GRUMPS
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5579028c6368722e0f002754#post_5579028c6368722e0f002754

Not saying I don't like Haytham or Edward, you said it yourself, those bad traits they had made them more 3 dimensional and they were palpable. If you ask me Connor had the exact same bad traits of Haytham but that's besides the point.

However there's also the difference in upbringing, Haytham being a British person raised to believe in control above everything to secure peace, Edward in getting money but learning self restraint, and when you realize it, those ideas and ways of thinking came from an outside source into their lives (Edward had Teach and Red, Haytham had Reginald Birche) whereas Connor had just himself to trust since his closest influences where all far too cynical to believe freedom was something to strive.

What does it say about people when the cynicals are the people we look up to?

"@HJSDGCE":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5579031d63687249a60001cd#post_5579031d63687249a60001cd

This.
topics.author: 4fdfbf92945b7075d50036e4
